Limited access to recycling facilities: Some areas of the city may not have convenient or accessible recycling facilities, making it difficult for residents to participate in the initiative.
Contamination of recyclables: If recyclables are not properly sorted or contaminated with non-recyclable materials, they may end up in landfills instead of being recycled.
Resistance from local businesses or residents: Some businesses or residents may be resistant to the idea of recycling, either due to cost concerns or because they do not see the benefit of it.
Inadequate funding: The initiative may require significant funding to establish and maintain recycling facilities, educate the public, and purchase necessary equipment.
Lack of data and analysis: Without proper data and analysis, it may be difficult to track the success of the initiative and identify areas for improvement.
